Meaning: A disease caused by the coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 that causes an infection of the respiratory tract
A form of atherosclerosis, a condition in which plaque builds up on the walls of arteries and increases the risk of other heart diseases
The most common type of dementia, which causes a decline in memory, thinking, and every day functioning. It is most common in the elderly and worsens over time

Cause: Bronchus or lung, unspecified - Malignant neoplasms
Meaning: Cancer, a disease in which cells grow out of control, in the lungs
Heart attack, where heart muscle dies due to an insufficient blood supply from a blockage of an artery
A form of atherosclerosis, a condition in which plaque builds up on the walls of arteries and increases the risk of other heart diseases
COPD, in which airflow in the lungs is obstructed by inflammation, causing a cough, mucus production, and difficulty breathing
The loss of intellectual abilities, including the ability to think and remember; personality changes; and emotional problems that is common in the elderly

Cause: Stroke, not specified as haemorrhage or infarction
Meaning: The death of a part of the brain due to a loss of blood supply from a blockage or a burst blood vessel
The sudden loss of heart activity due to an irregular heart beat
The decrease in the heart muscle's ability to pump blood, resulting in the body's blood demands being unmet and heart congested with blood

Cause: Intentional self-harm by other and unspecified firearm discharge
Meaning: Suicide using an unspecified type of firearm
A lung infection in which the air sacs in the lungs are inflamed and filled with fluid or pus, causing symptoms including coughing and difficulty breathing

Cause: Accidental poisoning by and exposure to narcotics and psychodysleptics [hallucinogens], not elsewhere classified
Meaning: Includes accidental overdose, use of the incorrect drug, unknowing use a drug, accidents with drugs during medical procedures, and poisoning with unknown intent. Drugs in this category include cannabis (derivatives), cocaine, codeine, heroin, lysergide (LSD), mescaline, methadone, morphine, and opium (alkaloids)
Shorthand: Accidental poisoning by or exposure to narcotics/hallucinogens

Cause: Hypertensive heart disease without (congestive) heart failure
Meaning: Chronic high blood pressure, which makes it harder for the heart to pump blood and causes the heart muscle to thicken and weaken. It increases the risk of other cardiovascular events, like a stroke or cardiac arrest.

Cause: Other ill-defined and unspecified causes of mortality
Meaning: Unexplained or unknown cause of death
Shorthand: Other ill-defined and unspecified causes of mortality

Cause: Accidental poisoning by and exposure to other and unspecified drugs, medicaments and biological substances
Meaning: Includes accidental overdose, use of the incorrect drug, unknowing use a drug, accidents with drugs during medical procedures, and poisoning with unknown intent. Drugs in this category include anaesthetics, hormones, antibiotics, vaccines, and drugs/agents affecting the cardiovascular, gastrointestinal, or respiratory systems
Shorthand: Accidental poisoning by or exposure to unspecified drugs or medical/biological substances
